007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a sphere centered at the origin.
016<p>
017   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphere" target="_top">
018                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphere</a>
019<p>
020   A sphere of radius {@code r} is the surface of revolution generated by
021   revolving a half-circle in the xy-plane with radius {@code r} and center
022   {@code (0,0,0)} around the y-axis.
023<p>
024   Here are parametric equations for the right half-circle in the xy-plane with
025   radius {@code r} and center {@code (0,0,0)}, parameterized from the top down.
026   <pre>{@code
027      x(phi) = r * sin(phi)  \
028      y(phi) = r * cos(phi)   |-  0 <= phi <= PI
029      z(phi) = 0             /
030   }</pre>
031   Here is the 3D rotation matrix that rotates around the y-axis
032   by {@code theta} radians, {@code 0 <= theta <= 2*PI}
033   <pre>{@code
034      [ cos(theta)   0   sin(theta)]
035      [     0        1       0     ]
036      [-sin(theta)   0   cos(theta)]
037   }</pre>
038   If we multiply the rotation matrix with the half-circle
039   parameterization, we get a parameterization of the sphere.
040   <pre>{@code
041      [ cos(theta)   0   sin(theta)]   [r * sin(phi)]
042      [     0        1       0     ] * [r * cos(phi)]
043      [-sin(theta)   0   cos(theta)]   [     0      ]
044
045      = ( r * sin(phi) * cos(theta).    \
046          r * cos(phi),                  |- 0<=theta<=2*PI,  0<=phi<=PI
047         -r * sin(phi) * sin(theta) )   /
048   }</pre>
049   See
050     <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphere#Equations_in_three-dimensional_space" target="_top">
051              https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphere#Equations_in_three-dimensional_space</a>
052
053   @see SphereSector
054*/
055public class Sphere extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
056{
057   public final double r;
058   public final int n;
059   public final int k;
060   public final MeshType type;
061
062   /**
063      Create a sphere of radius 1 centered at the origin.
064   */
065   public Sphere( )
066   {
067      this(1, 15, 16);
068   }
069
070
071   /**
072      Create a sphere of radius {@code r} centered at the origin.
073
074      @param r  radius of the sphere
075   */
076   public Sphere(final double r)
077   {
078      this(r, 15, 16);
079   }
080
081
082   /**
083      Create a sphere of radius {@code r} centered at the origin.
084   <p>
085      The last two parameters determine the number of half circles
086      of longitude and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
087   <p>
088      If there are {@code k} half circles of longitude, then each circle
089      of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
090      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude, then each half circle
091      of longitude will have {@code n+1} line segments.
092   <p>
093      There must be at least three half circles of longitude and
094      at least one circle of latitude.
095
096      @param r  radius of the sphere
097      @param n  number of circles of latitude
098      @param k  number of half circles of longitude
099      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
100      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
101   */
102   public Sphere(final double r, final int n, final int k)
103   {
104      this(r, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
105   }
106
107
108   /**
109      Create a sphere of radius {@code r} centered at the origin.
110   <p>
111      The last two parameters determine the number of half circles
112      of longitude and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
113   <p>
114      If there are {@code k} half circles of longitude, then each circle
115      of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
116      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude, then each half circle
117      of longitude will have {@code n+1} line segments.
118   <p>
119      There must be at least three half circles of longitude and
120      at least one circle of latitude.
121
122      @param r  radius of the sphere
123      @param n  number of circles of latitude
124      @param k  number of half circles of longitude
125      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
126      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
127      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
128   */
129   public Sphere(final double r, final int n, final int k,
130                 final MeshType type)
131   {
132      super(String.format("Sphere(%.2f,%d,%d)", r, n, k));
133
134      if (n < 1)
135         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 0");
136      if (k < 3)
137         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 2");
138
139      this.r = r;
140      this.n = n;
141      this.k = k;
142      this.type = type;
143
144      // Create the sphere's geometry.
145
146      final double deltaPhi = Math.PI / (n + 1),
147                   deltaTheta = (2 * Math.PI) / k;
148
149      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
150      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
151
152      // Create all the vertices.
153      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose an angle of longitude
154      {
155         final double c1 = Math.cos(j * deltaTheta),
156                      s1 = Math.sin(j * deltaTheta);
157         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose an angle of latitude
158         {
159            final double c2 = Math.cos(deltaPhi + i * deltaPhi),
160                         s2 = Math.sin(deltaPhi + i * deltaPhi);
161            v[i][j] = new Vertex( r * s2 * c1,
162                                  r * c2,
163                                 -r * s2 * s1 );
164         }
165      }
166      final Vertex northPole = new Vertex(0,  r, 0),
167                   southPole = new Vertex(0, -r, 0);
168
169      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
170      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
171      {
172         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
173         {
174            addVertex( v[i][j] );
175         }
176      }
177      addVertex(northPole,
178                southPole);
179      final int northPoleIndex = n * k,
180                southPoleIndex = northPoleIndex + 1;
181
182      // Create all the triangle strips between the top and bottom triangle fans.
183      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
184      {
185         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
186         {
187            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
188            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a half-circle of longitude
189            {
190               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j); // v[i  ][j]
191               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j); // v[i+1][j]
192            }
193            triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + 0); // v[i  ][0]
194            triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + 0); // v[i+1][0]
195            addPrimitive(triStrip);
196         }
197      }
198      // Create all the triangle strips between the top and bottom poles.
199      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
200      {
201         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a half-circle of longitude
202         {
203            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
204            triStrip.addIndex(northPoleIndex);
205            for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
206            {
207               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j);    // v[i][j  ]
208               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
209            }
210            triStrip.addIndex(southPoleIndex);
211            addPrimitive(triStrip);
212         }
213         // Last vertical strip to close the sphere.
214         final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
215         triStrip.addIndex(northPoleIndex);
216         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
217         {
218            triStrip.addIndex(i * k + k-1);  // v[i][k-1]
219            triStrip.addIndex(i * k + 0);    // v[i][0  ]
220         }
221         triStrip.addIndex(southPoleIndex);
222         addPrimitive(triStrip);
223      }
224      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
225      {
226         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
227         {
228            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a half-circle of longitude
229            {
230               addPrimitive(
231                  new TriangleStrip(   i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
232                                    (1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
233                                       i * k + j + 1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
234                                    (1+i)* k + j + 1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
235            }
236            addPrimitive(
237               new TriangleStrip(   i * k + k - 1, // v[i  ][k-1]
238                                 (1+i)* k + k - 1, // v[i+1][k-1]
239                                    i * k + 0,     // v[i  ][0  ]
240                                 (1+i)* k + 0));   // v[i+1][0  ]
241         }
242      }
243
244      // Create triangle fans at the top and bottom.
245      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
246        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
247      {
248         final Primitive topFan = new TriangleFan(),
249                         botFan = new TriangleFan();
250
251         topFan.addIndex(northPoleIndex);
252         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
253         {
254            topFan.addIndex( j );  // v[0][j]
255         }
256         topFan.addIndex( 0 );     // v[0][0]
257
258         botFan.addIndex(southPoleIndex);
259         for (int j = k - 1; j >= 0; --j) // choose a line of longitude
260         {
261            botFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+j ); // v[n-1][j]
262         }
263         botFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+k-1 );  // v[n-1][k-1]
264
265         addPrimitive(topFan,
266                      botFan);
267      }
268   }
269
270
271   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
272   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
273
274   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
275
276   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
277
278   @Override
279   public Sphere remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
280   {
281      return new Sphere(this.r, n, k, type);
282   }
283}//Sphere
